article.headline: Bucknell 63, Cornell 55
article.story: LEWISBURG, Pa. (AP) -- Donald Brown had 16 points and 10 rebounds for his first career double-double to lead Bucknell to a 66-55 victory over Cornell on Tuesday. Chris McNaughton added 13 points and nine rebounds for Bucknell (5-11), which held Cornell (6-8) 20 points below its season scoring average. Cody Toppert led the way for Cornell with 16 points and seven rebounds, while Ka'Ron Barnes also had 14 points and five rebounds. Bucknell won despite Cornell scoring 25 points off of 17 Bison turnovers. Bucknell scored eight points off of 12 turnovers by Cornell. Bucknell dominated inside, scoring 38 points in the paint, compared to just 12 points down low for Cornell. Abe Badmus and Kevin Bettencourt were the only Bucknell players to score 3-point shots, going 1-of-2 and 1-of-6 respectively. Bucknell led 25-19 at halftime.
